sub_title: Founder at LifeVersity | Educational Consultant & Trainer
summary:
Hello dear viewer! You stumbled upon that crazy student, who felt bored at the lectures and afterward always run to do some "board meeting", "project" or "event" instead of a beer.

During my bachelors I felt dissatisfied with largely theoretical nature of the studies, therefore I decided to run multiple of initiatives. Firstly, I led project Tea-at-5, where hundreds of students had a chance to practice conversations in English directly with foreigners. Lately,  I co-founded the first club of psychologist at our university, where we delivered workshops and brought alumni and external speakers to give practical advices. 

However, most of my activity of my bachelor studies belonged to youth leadership organization AIESEC which feed my need for experiences the most. From very first year I become a board member at AIESEC university office and later became a trainer at country level in Slovakia. All this knowledge & experience I utilized to get to a full-time position of country head of HR at AIESEC in Nepal. There I supported intensive growth and re-shaping of the organization, that was still recovering after massive earthquakes that happened a year before.

Lastly, I had also great opportunity to work at HR department in Dell in Slovakia. I am very grateful for a chance to meet a lot of HR professionals from whom I learned a lot about how human resources operates in the international company. 

Though above experiences shaped who I am, I'm would more likely define myself by my 3 core values of: Constant Improvement, Education & Honesty and my personal mission to contribute to improvement & innovation in education sector. 

Additionally, my current hobbies include acting&public speaking, painting, movies, travelling (34 countries), mountain trekking & my baby siblings. 

I'm always looking for cooperation or idea where I can contribute my skills and experience.

education.field_of_study: Psychology of Human Learning and Performance

projects.title: International Train the Trainers Conference 2015
projects.description: International Train the Trainers Seminar in Slovakia is 3 day conference focused on education of future trainers. In 2015 we had 110 delegates from 16 countries. Trainings and sessions were focused on topics like mainly public speaking, need of having a training, body language, audience management, delivery methods, improvisation, etc.

profile_positions.description:
Establishing HR processes supporting 200% growth achieved in provided voluntary internships.
- Leading large scale shift in organizational culture & change management of processes 
- Conducting job re-design and  job descriptions & characteristics for individual positions
- Managing recruitment & selection for membership and leadership positions (including developing selection criteria, process & tools, delivering train the interviewer trainings, personally leading interviews)  
- Creating recruitment marketing campaigns (logos, posters, video, lectures) 
- Creating and delivering education cycle for 3 branches with 100+ members combined (including knowledge hubs, personal development meetings, localized trainings & conferences and one 3day national conference) 
- Updating and developing internal HR policies
- Developing HR satisfaction surveys & improving member NPS by 41% 
- Developing online performance tracking systems, R&R process, Exit process and Alumni database
- Creating expansion marketing campaign and leading opening of new office in western part of Nepal (Nepalgunj)
- Creating quarterly HR analytics & HR reports
- Down-scaling global AIESEC strategies to local reality

profile_positions.description:
Voluntary position. Working and later leading team of 3 trainers, that was responsible for delivering training for new members and team-leaders of AIESEC Slovakia (around 250 members in total)

As a team:
- Planning and preparing interactive trainings focused mostly on Leadership, Presentations skills, Communication, Time management, Team management, Team work, Goal setting, etc. 
- Delivering soft-skills trainings for 8 national conferences (3-4days, 100-200 participants each)
- Organizing 8 Central training day events

As an individual:
- 500+ hours of training/workshop delivered
- Responsible for creating 4-day agenda for 80 delegates and managing team of 9 international trainers for national conference Dare 2014 & Dare 2015
- Responsible for creating agenda for advanced track (24 delegates) and delivering trainings for international train the trainers Slovakia 2015
- Leading a team since September 2015
- Conference Manager of International Train the Trainers Slovakia 2016
- Training on international Train the trainers conferences in Denmark & Poland and leadership development conferences in Belgium & Nepal.
